result.execSummary:
The defendant Jacob A. Kohel was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Fine/Forfeiture/Court Costs are not a condition of probation and are to be paid in full directly to the Clerk of Court's Office within 60 days or date provided by Court, unless a payment plan has been approved and set up through the Clerk of Court's Office.

Supervision fees
Any other conditions/counseling deemed appropriate by PO

timeConds.notes:
With Huber for all purposes.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jacob A. Kohel

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: No appearance or payment of fine, court orders warrant

3:06 p.m. Defendant Jacob A. Kohel in court with attorney Paul Arbuckle.  Steven Michlig appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Calling 15cf261, 15cm217, 14tr3158 and 15tr 1599.  State moves to amend Count 1 in 15cf261 to a Class A Misdemeanor - Bail Jumping - Granted. State moves to dismiss Counts 1, 3 and 4 in 15cm217 and 14tr3158 and 15tr1599 in their entirety - Granted. Plea questionnaire filed. Defendant enters no contest plea to 15cf261 and Count 2 in 15cm217.   Court reads on waiver of rights and tendering plea. Waiver free and voluntary. Court finds that a factual basis for the plea exists and finds defendant guilty. Victim Impact Statement filed. Michlig/Arbuckle/Defendant/Court statement on sentencing.
Court Sentence
WHS/POP - 1 year
Restitution - $594.00 (includes 10%)
CC/DNA Surcharge/Supervision Fees
  Fine/Forfeiture/Court Costs are not a condition of probation and are to be paid in full directly to the Clerk of Court's Office within 60 days or date provided by Court, unless a payment plan has been approved and set up through the Clerk of Court's Office.
Obtain/maintain full-time employment/school.
Conditional Jail - 5 days with Huber for all purposes to commence on/before Friday, April 1, 2016 at 4:00 p.m. 
Any other conditions/counseling deemed appropriate by PO.
Appeal rights given. Payment plan application given.
Review hearing scheduled for Monday, June 20, 2016 at 3:00 p.m. 
Adj. 3:25 p.m.

3:49 p.m. Defendant Jacob A. Kohel in court with attorney Paul Arbuckle.  Steven Mitchell Michlig appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Calling 15cf261, 15cm217, 14tr3158 and 15tr1599. Court quashes warrant previously authorized. Arbuckle just recently received discovery and offer to resolve - has not discussed with client. Bail continued. Adj. 3:51 p.m.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for March 17, 2016 at 02:30 pm.

1:56 p.m. Attorney Arbuckle in court.  Steven Mitchell Michlig appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Calling 15cf261, 15cm217, 14tr3158 and 15tr1599. Consent and Order for substitution of attorneys has been signed - Attorney Voorhees relieved of representation. Arbuckle expected defendant to be here today.  Michlig statement to snow - has been snowing for a little over an hour and less than an inch on the ground - Court states that snow conditions at this time are not prohibitive to travel. State moves for warrant. Court authorizes warrant. Adj. 2:00 p.m.
States Reply to Discovery  and State's Demand for Discovery  - includes cover letter

3:57 p.m. Defendant Jacob A. Kohel in court with attorney John E Voorhees.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Calling 15cf261 and 15cm217. In 15cf261, Voorhees receipt of Information - waive further reading - enter not guilty plea - Bail continued. Adj. 3:58 p.m.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for February 2, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

3:04 p.m. Defendant Jacob A. Kohel in court with attorney John Voorhees.  Steven Michlig appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Calling 15cf261, 15cm217, 14tr3158 and 15tr1599. Michlig moves for Court to take judicial notice of contents of 15 CM 217 - Voorhees statement  to judicial notice. Voorhees moves to dismiss for lack of probable cause for lack of intent to knowingly violate bond.  Court takes judicial notice of contents of 15cm217 including bond form signed by defendant. Court finds actual notice of hearing was given to defendant. Reasonable inference is intentionally violated bond - Court finds probable cause exists and binds defendant over. Court denies motion to dismiss. State files Information - Voorhees in receipt of Information - waives reading - Bail continued. Arraignment scheduled for November 30, 2015 at 03:30 pm. Adj. 3:13 p.m.

1:23 p.m. Defendant Jacob A. Kohel in court with attorney John E Voorhees.  Steven Mitchell Michlig appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Calling 15cf261, 15cm217, 14tr3158, 15tr1599.  Court quashes warrant in 15cm217 - not issued. Court questions Voorhees re nonappearance - Voorhees states that defendant was in Joliet, Illinois for funeral of cousin-returned today. Defendant apologizes for non-appearance came back from funeral early to make court date - thought it was 11/11/15. Court statement to meeting defendant in hallway prior to court appearance.   
In 15cf261, in receipt of complaint, waive reading -set for preliminary hearing - Time limits waived Michlig statement to bail - Court sets $2500 sig  bond.
15cm217 - status conference 11-19-2015 - Bail continued. Adj. 1:30 p.m. 
1:31 p.m. - Court advises defendant he needs to submit to booking in 15cf261.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for November 19, 2015 at 03:00 pm.
